scenario: Celsius Holdings reported Q4 2024 financial results with total revenue of $332.2 million, a 4% year-over-year drop, and adjusted earnings per share of $0.14, an 18% decline. Despite these numbers, the company's stock price surged 27% after announcing a $1.8 billion acquisition of Alani Nu, an energy drink rival. Celsius will pay $1.275 billion in cash, $25 million in potential earn-out payments, and $500 million in Celsius stock. The acquisition is expected to boost revenue by more than 40% and increase pro forma profitability by nearly 60%. The deal is expected to be accretive to cash earnings per share in the first year after closing and has already identified $50 million in cost synergies. The acquisition is expected to close in the second quarter of 2025.
